snippet: Behavioral economics has given us amazing new policy options to solve local and international problems.
abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column observes emergence of new kind of policy making in some areas of world based on idea that humans do not always make decisions in a rational or unbiased way; notes World Bank report detailing how insights of behavioral economics can be applied to global development and health; says that policies informed by behavioral economics are rooted in real human behavior, cheap yet effective and often superior to larger, more abstract policy favored by some governments.
lead_paragraph: Behavioral economics has given us amazing new policy options to solve local and international problems.
